entry.title: Changing Post Processing in DMEE
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently working on adapting DMEE format to align with the new ISO 20022 requirements, specifically for the CGI_XML_CT_V9 format. However, I'm encountering a blocking issue related to post processing of empty XML elements in the DMEE tree.

We are implementing the ISO pain 001.001.09 XML format, and during validation, the generated XML file fails.

I attempted to modify the Post Processing settings in the DMEE tree to adjust how empty elements are handled. The goal is to completely remove empty elements.

I followed these instructions: 3480644 - DMEE/DMEEX: XML Empty Element Processing

However, here's the issue:

  • I change the setting, save it, and activate the DMEE tree.

  • But every time I reopen the DMEE tree, the setting reverts back to ‚ÄúDO NOT REMOVE‚Äù ‚Äì the change doesn't persist.

This means my XML output is still invalid, and I cannot move forward with the bank's required format.

Has anyone experienced this rollback issue in the DMEE post processing settings?

 Any guidance would be greatly appreciated. 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Compound Employee API Query
entry.content:
Use queryMode=periodDelta

Fromdate = today and toDate = today

entry.title: Re: PIR Net price is not loading via Fiori Mass Changes
entry.content:
Probably, it would have been good had you shared the template where you maintained the value which is causing the issue. Now coming to your issue, not sure, whether you downloaded the template from the app itself or used any old template. If you have used any old template, try downloading the template from the app itself and test it.  Old templates might not work for many reasons.
As you might be knowing, SAP often expects the decimals with a dot and not comma. Hope, you have maintained the values with dot only. If you have maintained any currency symbol, remove that and upload, as this could be the root cause of the issue. Finally and most importantly, the excel stores the spaces and non-breaking spaces and ensure, you formatted such of those columns from Text to Columns to clean the field

entry.title: Manage access Business partner, Edit Address BP
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to create an authorisation role which should be able to change the email address on this screen.

I have listed the steps I took, as mentioned below, to try to make this work, but for some reason, it is not working as expected.

I have managed authorisation for many other fields with a similar setup. However, I am unsure why it isn‚Äôt working for the email address.

 

  1. Field grouping config is maintained per client (not maintained at any other level, i.e. per BP Role, Activity or BP type)

  1. The field group is added to the list of field groups for authorisation.

  1. The field group is added to the authorisation role assigned to the user.

  1. General '000000' BP role added to the Authorisation role.

  1. With the above configuration, I am still not able to edit the email address in change mode.

  1. Please see the screenshot from the BDT_ANALYZER. The field status for FLDGRP 0115 is still showing as hidden.

Can you please take a look and let me know if you spot anything obvious that I am doing wrong?

Thanks

Faraz

entry.title: Change stock with regards to UoM
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a material. Base Unit of measure is PC, Alternative UoM is KG. 1 PC = 1 KG

Current stock is 100 PC.

In fact the the weight of 1 PC is 2 KG. We want to change Alternative UoF saying that 1 PC = 2 KG. It means that our stock should be reduced to: 100 / 2 = 50 PC

How to do this? Any movement types?

Thanks.

entry.title: Creation of User Roles in Integration Suite with API
entry.content:
Hello,
I would like to create Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) User Roles via API, but there is no documented API. In API Business Hub I can find APIs for many objects, but not for User Roles (https://api.sap.com/api/SecurityContent/resource).

In the UI I can create user roles via http://xxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com/shell/monitoring/UserRoles, which uses the endpoint https://xxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com/rest/api/v1/tenants/roles/customroles

Unfortunately, this endpoint uses a cookie to authenticate. Any idea how I could create a User Roles using an API?

Thanks,
Maximilian

I could do this in the Class, CL_EAMS_UI_FD_ORDNTF_INIT --> Method, AUTHORITY_CHECK_TRAN. Debugging this method further to understand how I can know whether it's called for a change or display. Will update the thread once I get a break here.

 

With regards to the original query, per my analysis, we can restrict it in the DPC_EXT Class, CL_EAM_OBJPG_MAINTORD_DPC_EXT --> Method: /IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET. Here in post exit, I thought I can remove the records based on logged in user and person responsible.

Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: MODIFY ENTITIES OF Purchase order item pricing elements (conditions)
entry.content:
Hi Team,

  I have to update the Purchase order item pricing conditions of PMPO and ZDL1 to ZDL4 ( discount level in a bulk through RAP ABAP. I am using this statement by collecting all PO items pricing conditions in  lt_update1 and updating. But this statement is not updating for multiple POs but updates for single PO. Could you please provide your suggestions .
MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_purchaseordertp_2
ENTITY purorderitempricingelement
UPDATE FROM lt_update1
FAILED DATA(ls_failed1)
MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped)
REPORTED DATA(ls_reported1).

Could you please clarify below queries.

1. Please let me know if failed records of all Purchase orders will be collected in 'FAILED DATA'. 

2. Will the successful purchase order update will be rolled back if any one of the purchase order has any errors i,e will we able to update all POs only if there is no error POs?

Thanks & Regards,

Rajeswari

entry.title: Re: Change Master Template for PO Print with Adobe Designer
entry.content:
Hello @Dylan2 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, each master page in Adobe Forms controls a specific layout. If you want your company name or legal text to appear across the PO.

  • Add the company name to each master page used (like Landscape, Portrait); otherwise, it won‚Äôt show on all pages.
  • For legal provisions that appear once, create a separate master page and use conditional display (only on the last page).

Editing one master page won‚Äôt affect the others. Each is used independently based on form logic.

Explaining Master Form Templates-SAP Learning 

Maintain Form Templates for Administrator-F1434/S34

Maintain Form Templates SAP Help

SAP Learning Hub-Maintaining Customer Content Form Templates 

Let me know if it was helpful

With regards

Chuma

Hey Guys,

I need your help.

My case: I create and release a new production order, execute WM Material Staging and set a TO (Foreground / Background) in Transfer Requirements. 

I want to have a different LTBP-LGORT for the material. The system takes RESBD-LGORT as standard, but I need it dynamically choosen by certain conditions . This should be done automatically in an user-exit or enhancement point.

Sadly I haven't found any suitable user-exit for that. PPCO0005, MWMTR001 or MWMTO001 don't get called (Yes, active project in CMOD) and MWMPP001 can't be used to change LGORT.

Any ideas, how I can get this done?
Please don't be to harsh to me, I'm new to SAP üòÆ

Greetings
Patrick

entry.title: Business Partner details from CAMT EBS statements not correctly filled for Returns
entry.content:
Question about payment returns in CAMT Electronic Bank Statements. 


Our problem is that Business Partner details from CAMT statements filled with our own data, not data for real Business Partner. The root cause is that in SAP Standard transformation FIEB_CAMT053_V8_TO_FEB for these fields for Credit transaction (CdtDbtInd = CRDT) are filled from Debtor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/DbtrAgt). For payments it works correct. But for returns, our banks sends us statements with CdtDbtInd = CRDT and Business Partner information in Creditor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/CdtrAgt). So, one of these two (either SAP or our Bank) treats it not right. I'm trying to understand who? Would be appreciated for your advices, about how correctly it should be filled (in Debtor or Creditor section)? Is there any guidance in CAMT format description for specific processes (like returns)?

entry.title: Re: Complete Guide to SAP Desktop Agent: Installation, Errors, and Resolutions
entry.content:
@maharana Many thanks for sharing your experience with such a comprehensive blog.

I have had a challenge with the Desktop Agent as well. I'm hoping someone at SAP will read this comment and take some action!

Originally I had to use the manual method to download the agent due to being a P-User. The version available on the download site (SAP Development Tools) was and still is 3.32.58. The current version via the S-User download is 3.42.50.

This difference in version number caused problems for my testing when version 3.32.58 wasn't compatible with my developments at some point in time (I needed a newer version).

I wish that whenever a new version is released, SAP would update the manual download page accordingly - that would greatly help those P user developers using the trial account to get a proof of concept working. (The change of version issue affected my ability to demo a POC to the business) - very frustrating.

Anyway, that is my little experience I thought I'd share ..... SAP are you listening ???

Best regards Adrian

entry.title: Re: The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code
entry.content:
Great blog @Marian_Zeis 

I recently came across multiple requirements were ideally actions could be useful, but in the end it was better to make it in a different way.  The main reason being how odd unbound actions are in RAP and limitations on abstract entities and their support for actions.

All those requirements were "too simple" that no fiori elements floorplan were a good fit. Just a classic input screen and a button to do something (move stock, post an accounting document etc).

I decided to create an abstract root entity with a single static/unbound action inside it with importing parameters. Inside the behavior pool the plan was to use EML to trigger MODIFY statements (such as CREATE or ACTION) on the standard business objects. This seems piece of cake but it's pretty much impossible (based on S/4HANA 2023).

My conclusion is RAP really lacks simplicity when you don't have a database table. In other words, it becomes simpler if you just create a table even when you do not need it. There should be a fiori elements floorplan to something similar to a executable program in ABAP where you don't have an output (or if your output is not a table).

I'd like to share in summary what I've done in 2 of such requirements

In one requirement I had to call a BAPI that would move stock between different locations based on a selection screen. I created a freestyle app that triggers a CREATE (POST) request just to take data on the selection screen and save on a (new) custom table. I used a managed key to generate the ID on each new entry. The freestyle app would then call an action for that new entry right away by passing that key (bound action). So there are 2 roundtrips. To add insult to injury, it was not possible to call the BAPI inside the behavior pool directly due to illegal statements in the behavior pool (by far one of the most annoying things in RAP). So the action basically calls the a FM in a separate task to move stock. To be honest I don't even remember why I decided to use OData V2 instead of V4 but there was some good reason.

The second requirement was actually very similar to the first one except that the input screen had a nested structure (deep entity in gateway terms). In the end I created a freestyle app now using OData V4 and initially I was doing 2 roundtrips as well. Then it became clear that it was possible to place everything on the same CREATE (POST) call. Still, it was very challenging to call the actions in OData V4 even knowing the 'execute' and 'invoke' methods. The way the action response was handled by SAPUI5 was very different depending if the action returned a $self of an abstract entity. The most important takeaway of that was that a "Context" in SAPUI5 does not always represent "a row" in the database but it can also be an abstraction of an action. Interesting in one hand, very confusing on the other. Forcing everything to be based on Contexts make the OData V4 ODataModel in UI5 very hard to use and way more complex than what it used to be in V2.

In other words I was almost forced to create database tables to fulfill both requirements. Those tables were not needed but at least they serve as "logs" that records each and every execution (together with its parameters and response). Still, compared to the effort if I'd create a SEGW project for each requirement, it would be way more simpler. SEGW and DPC classes gives you freedom that it's everything you need on something "too simple". Sorry saying that for any RAP fans out there.

Both apps were created in Typescript and I do not regret doing it.

entry.title: Unable to Reconcile USD Payment with USD Invoice If Customer is All Currency
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using SAP Business One with local currency set to EGP (Egyptian Pound).
We have a customer defined as "All Currencies".

Scenario:

- In February, we received an incoming payment in USD from the customer to a USD bank account, using an exchange rate of 60

- In June, we issued a USD invoice to the same customer, but at an exchange rate of 50.

- When trying to clear the invoice using the earlier payment (through Incoming Payments or manual reconciliation), we are facing the following issues

- The Cumulative Balance in FC (USD) is not equal to the Balance Due FC.

- The system only allows clearing in local currency (EGP) ‚Äî it does not allow us to choose USD as the clearing currency.

- No option appears to settle in the original transaction currency (USD).

Question:

- Is there a way to force or allow clearing in foreign currency (USD) instead of local currency?

- How can we reconcile or match USD payments against USD invoices with different exchange rates?

- Is there a recommended workaround for this scenario 

Any insights would be highly appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: Redis on SAP BTP: How it can support the Clean Core approach
entry.content:
In the evolving landscape of enterprise application development, SAP‚Äôs Clean Core approach enables customers building scalable, maintainable, and future-proof solutions. It emphasizes keeping the SAP S/4HANA core system clean of custom code and extensions, providing the guidance and the path for pushing such customizations to the Business Technology Platform (BTP). In this context, Redis on SAP BTP emerges as a powerful enabler for Clean Core adherence ‚Äî enhancing performance, backend protection, and helping reduce total cost of ownership (TCO).

This post explores how Redis on SAP BTP, an in-memory cache service known for its speed and versatility, complements the Clean Core principles on SAP BTP.

Understanding the Clean Core Principles

The Clean Core philosophy promotes:

  • Minimizing custom code in the SAP core (S/4HANA).
  • Leveraging SAP BTP for extensions, side-by-side applications, and innovations.
  • Ensuring upgrade compatibility and operational stability.

To achieve this, enterprises must offload processing and data handling away from the core. Redis, as a cloud-native service on SAP BTP, can help in achieving this separation effectively.

Redis: A Clean Core ally

Redis on SAP BTP can serve as a central caching and transient data layer, which is essential for modern SAP extensions. Here‚Äôs how it can support the Clean Core approach:

1. Performance Acceleration with Caching

SAP backend systems can be burdened with frequent reads for non-critical data such as configuration, product lists, or metadata. Offloading these to Redis allows:

  • Millisecond response times.
  • Reduced pressure on core resources.
  • Improved user experience in frontend apps (Fiori) or custom BTP services.

Example: Use Redis to cache product availability data in an e-commerce extension instead of querying the S/4HANA system repeatedly.

2. Backend Protection with Rate Limiting and Queuing

Redis supports structures like token buckets and queues, which can protect backend systems from unexpected load surges:

  • Implement dynamic rate limiting to throttle requests to SAP S/4HANA APIs.
  • Use Redis streams or lists as buffer queues for processing backend-intensive operations asynchronously.

Example: Protect an order management system by queueing bulk order uploads in Redis, then processing them in controlled batches, for simple scenarios,  for more complex and critical scenarios please check SAP BTP Event Mesh.

3. Transient Data Handling for Microservices

Typically Clean Core-aligned applications are stateless microservices running on SAP BTP. Redis can act as a session store, short-lived cache, or inter-process communication layer, enabling smooth service orchestration without bloating the SAP core.

Example: Use Redis to temporarily store workflow state transitions in a BPM-like extension until they‚Äôre finalized and written back to SAP.

4. Supporting Clean Core with lower TCO

Running Redis on SAP BTP helps to ensure:

  • Managed service with autoscaling, reducing infrastructure overhead.
  • Serverless and cost-efficient usage patterns, especially for caching-heavy use cases.
  • Separation of concerns: offloading computation and storage to Redis reduces costs for high-throughput backend operations.

By smartly caching and decoupling operations, organizations can reduce the number of backend calls, ultimately lowering SAP API consumption costs and database load.

Conclusion

Redis on SAP BTP is more than a high-speed cache service ‚Äî  can be a enabler component for implementing Clean Core-aligned architectures. It boosts performance,  protects backend systems from overload, supports stateless application design, and lowers TCO.

 
Thanks for reading!
For more insights from the product team on Redis on SAP BTP, don't miss to read:
  • Redis on SAP BTP - INDEX of official blog posts
Regards, 
Antonio

entry.title: Oppt Prioritization score custom Agent in SAP CX AI Toolkit
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to create a custom AI agent for opportunities called Oppt Prioritization score agent. For this i created an AI Tool by giving the following prompt:

You are an opportunity prioritization agent in the SAP CX AI Toolkit for SAP Sales Cloud V2. Analyze all opportunities with Opprtunity.Status with Open status.

Calculate the prioritization score based on the following weighted criteria:
1. Opportunity.Expected_Value (50% weight)
2. Opportunity.Probability (30% weight)
3. Opportunity.Close_Date within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date (20% weight)
Assumptions
4.Opportunity.Probability is assumed to be a percentage (0-100).
5.The Opportunity.Close_Date condition is binary, based on whether it falls within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date, interpreted as future dates for prioritization.

Priotitization Score = 0.5*{Opportunity.Expected_Value} + 0.3*{Opportunity.Probability} + 0.2*{cases}
1 {ifOpportunity.Close_Date is within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date} else
0
end{cases}

Provide a one-sentence explanation per opportunity justifying its ranking and, sorted by Amount (descending). Use a professional tone and avoid technical jargon.
For each opportunity, provide a brief, actionable follow-up recommendation (e.g., ‚ÄúSchedule a discovery call to discuss budget constraints‚Äù). Use a concise, professional tone and leverage intelligent Q&A to ensure recommendations are contextually relevant.
Include a summary of recent interactions for each opportunity, generated using the toolkit‚Äôs AI summary capabilities. Use a professional tone and ensure recommendations support team collaboration.
Ensure Output Fits Within 5000 Chatacters
Compact Formatting--> Remove unnecessary spaces & line breaks.
Limit Answer Length--> Max 500 Characters per answer, truncate with "..."

I assigned this AI tool to the custom AI Agent.The details (PFA screenshot) which are used are

Expected value = 15000 USD

Probability = 80

Close Date = 25 Jul 2025

The calculation for close date is incorrect, it should be 1, but it is coming as 0. Any suggestions how can i achieve the condition for the close date?

entry.title: AI Won‚Äôt Save Bad Data: Lessons from the Field in Supplier Management
entry.content:
Let‚Äôs be honest: supplier management isn‚Äôt always glamorous.

You know that moment when a supplier insists they‚Äôve already registered ‚Äî and you realize they used the wrong ANID (again)? Or when you're prepping for a risk review and notice half your supplier questionnaires are incomplete?

In my role in SAP Solution Value Advisory, I work with customers across industries to help them get the most out of SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle & Performance (SLP) and Supplier Risk. Every company is different, but the challenges tend to be the same ‚Äî especially as AI becomes a bigger part of the conversation.

One thing I say to customers (half-joking, half-pleading) is this: AI won‚Äôt save bad data. It‚Äôll just make your bad data faster.

If you're aiming for AI-driven insights and automation, the groundwork matters more than ever. That means:

  • Structuring your supplier registration flows thoughtfully, and using Modular Questionnaires where applicable
  • Regularly cleaning up duplicate or inactive supplier records
  • Making it easy ‚Äî and worthwhile ‚Äî for suppliers to participate

Set Your Suppliers Up for Success

I‚Äôve seen too many teams stuck chasing suppliers to complete registrations, risk assessments, and questionnaires. Features like automated reminders and nudges can help, but participation truly improves when:

  • Suppliers understand what‚Äôs in it for them
  • The process is simple and straightforward
  • You provide clear guidance (even a short how-to video can work wonders)

We can‚Äôt control supplier behavior ‚Äî but we can control the experience we create.


Not Sure Where to Start?

Here are a few lesser-used gems in Ariba SLP that can make a big difference in onboarding and maintaining clean supplier data:

  • Process Framework ‚Äì Collect supplier info that‚Äôs commodity/region-specific, or doesn‚Äôt belong in the initial registration
  • Preferred Supplier Flags ‚Äì Especially useful if you're using Guided Buying
  • Approval Workflows by Category or Region ‚Äì More control without more noise
  • Supplier Data Snapshots & Reporting ‚Äì Track onboarding durations, identify bottlenecks, and analyze where your process might be over-engineered.

Maybe you‚Äôre collecting data too early. Maybe some supplier types are being asked for more than they need to provide. Don‚Äôt be afraid to question whether your current setup still fits your organization‚Äôs broader Source-to-Pay process.

Data Today = AI Tomorrow

Customers often ask me:
‚ÄúWill Ariba use AI to flag risky suppliers?‚Äù
‚ÄúCan it automate profile scoring?‚Äù

Yes ‚Äî exciting things are on the way. But AI depends on patterns. And patterns only emerge from clean, complete, consistent data. Think of it like training a chef with a messy fridge. If half your ingredients are mislabeled, expired, or missing, you‚Äôre not getting a Michelin-star meal, you‚Äôre getting mystery soup.

What I‚Äôd love to hear from you:
What‚Äôs your biggest supplier management headache? What clever workaround have you built in Ariba? How do you motivate suppliers to fill out their info?

Drop a comment or message me here in the SAP Community, I‚Äôd love to connect!

entry.title: SAP Analytic Cloud has really limited functionalities. Am I using it correctly?
entry.content:
Hey gurus,
supposedly this is SAP's product to compete against tableau or power bi

  • Linked dimension has to be in the graph or widget not working, so it's extremely limited compared to power pivot which can be sliced however you want as long as there's a linked dimension.

For example if i have a table with sales and customer ID and another table with customer ID and customer region. Power pivot can easily do a graph of sales by customer region as long as customer ID fields are linked. Whereas in SAC, the linked dimension which is the customer ID has to stay in the graph or it renders error. but what's the point of linked dimension havng to be in the graph to make it work? the whole point of linking to me is establishing relationship so that I can explor the data in differe ways.

  • No good way to do calculations easily, eg if sales is a measure, it doesn‚Äôt seem possible to do counts/sum/avg at the same time or to do filtering by criteria(sales > 100$). If it‚Äôs dimension, sum is not possible. The dimension to measure function can only do count/avg.
  • Data models not working in stories only working if I go to data analyzer and do ad hoc.

entry.title: Re: Need to modify Reference Number (VBRK-XBLNR) in Billing document VF01
entry.content: changing the XBLNR (Reference Document Number) field in the VBRK (Billing Document Header) table in SAP can be considered a malpractice and might be penalized during an audit. The XBLNR field is intended to store the customer's purchase order number or a relevant reference for the billing document. Altering this field after the document is created can obscure the original reference, leading to discrepancies and potentially masking errors or fraudulent activities.

entry.title: Re: Where are exchange rates actually used in business pr...
entry.content:
Hi @Simon_Lehnert ,

Here is small synopsis of usage.

ModuleProcessExchange Rate UsageExampleKey T-Codes
FI (Financial Accounting)Foreign currency journal entriesConverts foreign currency to company code currencyUSD invoice posted in EUR company codeFB50, FB60, F-53
 Incoming/Outgoing paymentsRevaluation at clearing, gain/loss calculatedPayment after FX rate changesF-28, F-53
 Month-end valuationUnrealized FX valuationF.05 calculates FX gain/loss on open itemsF.05
 Asset transactionsConverts acquisition cost in foreign currencyAsset purchased in USD in EUR ledgerABZON, AB01
MM (Materials Management)Purchase Order (PO)Converts PO value from vendor currencyPO in USD for EUR companyME21N
 Goods Receipt (GR)Uses exchange rate to calculate GR/IR in local currencyUSD PO posted at current EUR rateMIGO
 Invoice Receipt (IR)Converts invoice amount to company currencyExchange difference between GR and IRMIRO
SD (Sales and Distribution)Sales OrderPricing in foreign currency converted to localSO created in USD for EUR companyVA01
 Billing DocumentRevenue in both foreign and company currencyUSD billing posted to EUR ledgerVF01, VF03
 Revenue RecognitionApplies historical rate for accrual/revenue matchingEnsures consistency over timeVF44, FARR_RAI_MON
CO (Controlling)Internal postings across currenciesConverts cost postings to controlling area currencyActivity allocation USD ‚Üí EURKB21N, KSB1
 Plan vs ActualCurrency fluctuation affects cost comparisonFX impact on budgeted costsKP06, KSB1
TRM (Treasury & Risk)FX contracts, hedgingUses daily exchange rates for valuationUSD/EUR FX forward contractTPM60, TBB1
 Position valuationDaily mark-to-market revaluationPortfolio revalued with M rateTPM1, TBB4
PS (Project System)WBS cost planningConverts project costs from transaction to controlling currencyProject in USD, controlling in EURCJ20N, CJ40
TM (Travel Management)Expense reimbursementReimburses employee in local currencyTrip in USD, paid in EURPR05, FI-TV
Group Reporting / ConsolidationFinancial consolidationConverts local currency to group currencyConsolidation at HQ level (e.g., EUR)CX00, ACDOCU reports
Intercompany BillingCross-currency reconciliationApplies exchange rate during intercompany invoiceUSD invoice to EUR sister companyVF01, FB60

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: MODIFY ENTITIES OF Purchase order item pricing elemen...
entry.content:
1. Please let me know if failed records of all Purchase orders will be collected in 'FAILED DATA'. 

Yes

2. Will the successful purchase order update will be rolled back if any one of the purchase order has any errors i,e will we able to update all POs only if there is no error POs?

No

=== 

Your question is missing some important details but one common reason, assuming your are not using this MODIFY ENTITIES inside a behavior pool class is the absence of COMMIT ENTITIES statement. If you are using EML outside a behavior pool you must explicitly call it.

entry.title: Re: Country-Spec Enhance are missing from the Manage Busi...
entry.content:
Hello 

The Fiori Apps i.e. Manage Business Partner Master Data App , Manage Customer Master Data App and Manage Supplier Master Data App  are lighter versions and have been designed for specific use cases with the most commonly used fields. These Apps are being enhanced with more business use cases and fields over time based on SAP Customer Influence Requests.

Tab "Country-spec. Enh." is invisible in Fiori App Fiori Apps i.e. Manage Business Partner Master Data App , Manage Customer Master Data App and Manage Supplier Master Data App  but accessible in Maintain Business Partner.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Cloud ALM and SAP BPA Integration
entry.content:
Presently, SAP Cloud ALM offers a built-in option to define a Requirements approval workflow that can integrate with SAP Build Process Automation.  There is no option to define a workflow for a Projects > Features, nor other Subscription types (e.g. User Story, Project Task, etc).  

See KBA 3634841.

Blog: SAP Cloud ALM: requirement approval with external ... - SAP Community share information on configuring this for Requirements.

entry.title: Calling cloud foundry application using rest api via destination from fiori in BAS
entry.content:
I have deployed my backend developed using python in the cloud foundry dev space with the Oauth2.0 security. I can access it using all the credentials from postman without any problem.

I created a destination for the application and checked it. It shows "Connection to "NewCrew" established. Response returned: "200: OK" "

Now I want to call this application using the destination  I created from the fiori application.

I created a Fiori UI using Basic Fiori Template. I didn't create a MTA 

# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/schema/ui5.yaml.json

specVersion: "3.1"
metadata:
  name: fioricrew
type: application
server:
  customMiddleware:
    - name: fiori-tools-proxy
      afterMiddleware: compression
      configuration:
        ignoreCertError: true # If set to true, certificate errors will be ignored. E.g. self-signed certificates will be accepted
        backend:
          - path: /app
            destination: NewCrew
            pathReplace: ""
            forwardAuthToken: true
        ui5:
          path:
            - /resources
            - /test-resources
          url: https://ui5.sap.com
        debug: true
    - name: fiori-tools-appreload
      afterMiddleware: compression
      configuration:
        port: 35729
        path: webapp
        delay: 300
    - name: fiori-tools-preview
      afterMiddleware: fiori-tools-appreload
      configuration:
        flp:
          theme: sap_horizon

 This is my UI5.yaml .

{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [

    {
      "source": "^/app/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "NewCrew",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "forwardAuthToken": true

    },
    {
      "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
   
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
      
    }
  ]
}

This is my xs-app.json.

 _callAIService: function (sQuery) {
            const sUrl = "/app/api/query"; 
            const oPayload = {
                "user_request": sQuery
            };

            // Add a "typing..." indicator for better UX
            this._addMessageToChat("...", "ai_typing");
        
            let oResponse; // Variable to hold the response object
        
            fetch(sUrl, {
                method: "POST",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
                body: JSON.stringify(oPayload)
            })
            .then(response => {
                oResponse = response; // Store the response so we can access it in the catch block
                if (!response.ok) {
                    // Throw an error to be caught by the .catch block
                    throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);
                }
                return response.json();
            })

This is my View1.controller.js 

this is all the files I have.

I used ui5 serve to test the application.

I always get the 500 error.  I tried to debug using developer tools on chrome but this is all I could find 
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 ()
Im trying to access the backend from the BAS using the destination I configured. 
I have tried all the tutorials and videos out there but I couldn't get this to work. 

Im new to SAP and I don't know what Im doing wrong. Every video I watched they all used odatagen. I have no clue what I'm doing wrong here. i have default-env.json as well. Im trying to make it work for a week but I couldn't. Please someone help me in this.

entry.title: SAP ME/MII msg type yieldConfirmationRequest goes into RETRY status and MESYS blocks reservation
entry.content:
Hi Experts ,

 

Did you faced these behaviours:

     SAP ME/MII native message type yieldConfirmationRequest goes always into RETRY status when is processed for the

first time and only when the message is re-processed , the second time , it goes into correct status PASSED ; This is not good

at all because it increasing the processing time of the messages inside the MII queue ;

     The second behavior is that the componentAddRequest message always goes first into FAILED status with the message:

User MESYS blocks the reservation xxxxxxxxxxxx  ; Those kind of failed messages became PASSED only if they are manually RETRY; This is not good also because a time consuming manually intervention is needed  ;

    The above behaviours appeared after we installed: 

                                    SAP ME 15.5 Patch 43 first and then Patch 44 , SAP XMII 15.5.2.1 and  SAP MII_ADMIN 15.5.2.1 ;

    Thank you in advance for your help !

 

Best Regards,

Paul

entry.title: Re: Cannot cancel VLS class with inactive VLS instructor
entry.content:
Swapnil, thanks very much for the detailed response. I'm assuming that when you say "reinstate the instructor as the organizer," that means making them the primary instructor? (I wasn't able to remove the inactive instructor as primary anyway.) I have requested our internal MS Teams administrative team to temporarily reactivate the MS Teams license. Fingers crossed it is approved!

Marie, thanks for your feedback and for the validation that we've done as much as we can in the LMS interface. I did advise our enterprise learning team to try to catch instructors on their way out to modify VLS classes before they are deactivated, but I know that is rarely possible. This is actually the first time we've had this issue, surprisingly. And I was referring to talking to our internal MS Teams "messaging" team that manages our enterprise Teams configuration and licensing.

I tried running ui5 serve and I only got this.

URL: http://localhost:8080

I tried to get the logs from the application deployed in cloud foundry. but nothing is there .

entry.title: Shared Resource Scenario in PPDS
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have a case where two packing lines share 6 hoppers. The goal is to make sure these hoppers are used properly when scheduling orders in PPDS.

For example:

  1. If Packing Line 1 uses 3 hoppers, then Packing Line 2 can use the remaining 3.
  2. If Packing Line 1 uses 4 hoppers, then only 2 are left for Packing Line 2.

While scheduling, we need to:

  1. Use the hopper capacity efficiently and keep both packing lines running without idle time.
  2. Schedule orders based on priority and with minimal setup time

Mapping the Hoppers in S4 and PPDS - 

Currently, the business defines hopper availability by quantity (number of hoppers), not by time (hours). So, how should we maintain its capacity?

Let us know if you guys have come across a similar scenario in any of your projects, and feel free to share any suggestions or recommendations you might have.

Thanks

Debasis Nanda

entry.title: Re: Calling cloud foundry application using rest api via destination from fiori in BAS
entry.content: Based on your posted Javascript code it looks like you are executing a fetch and inside the returned promise you output the HTTP error response. That means your application is making the request but the server is responding with a failure... meaning the detail would be in the logs of your backend, and you have indicated that is a python service in your post.
